eHealth Xpo

Electronic Healthcare Record (EHR)

Virtual Trade Show

General objectives:

  • To develop/leverage a virtual event infrastructure/platform, process, and marketing strategy that can be repurposed for use in the execution of multiple virtual events (Goal is 3-4 events for year one).

  • To be first to market to introduce a dynamic, virtual event platform to multiple high technology industries and vertical markets. The eHealthcare market segment will be targeted initially.

  • To provide a distinctive communication and branding platform and value proposition (low cost, high return) to participating sponsors and vendors.

  • To provide a unique, cost-effective, high awareness exposition experience to attendees, complemented by extended (real-time/offline), ubiquitous access (anytime, anywhere).

Background/Drivers:

Establishing and harmonizing architecture, data standards, and technical certification to develop an Internet-based health information exchange has not been easy. However, over the course of the last 10-15 years - since the introduction of such healthcare standards and regulatory committees such as HIPAA, HL7, etc. - eHealthcare systems have gained momentum, and will continue to do so. Case in point, President Bush has called for a nationwide system of interoperable e-health records by 2014.

The primary driver and compelling reason for healthcare organizations to establish an EHR framework is clear. eHealthcare systems ensure the privacy and security of patient records. Moreover, eHealthcare systems elevate the quality and proficiency of patient care thereby enabling a higher level of patent safety. Process efficiencies are good thing. However, with deaths due to medical errors approaching 200,000 per year, instituting an error-free patient care solution is paramount.

Now that the market has structure, providers, medical professionals, and IT vendors have begun to emerge in droves, providing innovative products, creating process efficiencies, and improving the quality of patient care. eHealth Xpo EHR virtual trade show will provide a platform through which these vendors can gain exposure for their company, introduce new products and solutions, share best practices, and benefit from numerous lead generation opportunities for their target market - hospitals, clinics, physician practices, and home healthcare, and acute care organizations.


Time-frame: Q4’05 - Q1’06. The target date will be contingent on infrastructure setup, marketing and promotion timeline, and industry event calendar impact.

Online Duration: 3 Days

Offline Access: 2 Weeks show (24/7)

Registration Fees: $150 real-time access; $75 off-line access

Target Audience:

Goal: 2,500-3,500 (1,500-2,500 real-time, 1,000 offline)

Profile: Attendees will be comprised of marketing directors, product managers and company officers who benefit from up-to-the-minute analysis of and strategic advice about new product development, marketing strategy and trend analysis.

Target Vendors:

Goal: 60-100

Profile: eHealth Xpo is designed for both large and small vendors in the Healthcare IT space. Vendor products include hardware, software, and integrated platform solutions that address the eHealth application requirements of hospitals, clinics, physician practices, and home healthcare, and acute care organizations.

Target vendors would include companies like Eclipsys, GE Medical Systems, Epic Systems, Medical Records Institute, Panasonic, Fujitsu, NextGen, McKesson, Cerner, Siemens Medical Solutions, Stinger Industries, etc.


eHealth Xpo EHR Virtual Tradeshow Objectives:

The objective of the eHealth Xpo is to address the various interests and needs of both the attendee and the participating vendors. These areas include: industry trends, educational programs, networking, and lead generation.

Industry Trends

This area will focus on industry trends, regulatory standards, technology – their implementation and applications, and best practices. The primary delivery vehicle will be keynote presentations by industry experts, analysts, and noted company executives.

Keynote/Breakout topical suggestions include:

  • Analysis of current eHealthcare IT market, technology trends and market growth

  • Overview of current developments in government, patient safety, efficiency, quality of care

  • Understanding EHR concepts and technology: CPR, CMR, EPR, EMR, DMR, PMRI, PHR, etc.

  • Provider strategies for cutting healthcare costs

  • Standards and IT developments (weaknesses and expectations)

  • Acute care market

  • Ambulatory care market

  • Effective and rewarding strategic technology alliances

  • Implementing an eHealth EHR system.

    • Current Hurdles Facing EHRs

    • The Survey on EHR Trends and Usages

    • Functions of the EHR

    • Dimensions of the EHR

    • Applications, not Records

    • Small Steps toward EHR Adoption

  • Primer for healthcare IT startups (funding, strategy, pitfalls, etc.)

  • Marketing strategy (how to develop and evaluate)

Education

This area will focus on practical educational programs, giving the attendee the opportunity to learn about and evaluate available technologies, vendors, and select systems from 60-100 exhibiting companies. The primary delivery vehicle for these programs will be vendor sponsored breakout sessions that include vendor specific product and solution presentations.

Specific topical areas will include:

Emerging technologies, mobile healthcare devices, and integrated cart solutions; ePrescription, practice management, and medical record document imaging and content management applications; Computerized/Mobile Order Entry systems (CPOE/MPOE) and EHR systems for hospitals and small, medium, and large practices.


Networking

Networking is an indispensable activity that provides tremendous value-add to the program for the attendees. It is also a primary goal and benefit for the participating vendors/sponsors. Networking at eHealth Xpo will be very effective due to the underlying technology found in the InXpo engine. Networking and communication among the attendees and vendors will be accomplished through varied activities such as interactive Q&A during key presentation and learning sessions, general and categorized event chat rooms, direct C2C, B2C, and B2B communication sessions and VCD exchanges.

Lead Generation

The primary reason vendors participate in marketing activities such eHealth XPO is to create demand for their products and services and achieve their customer acquisition goals. Additionally, events such as eHealth Xpo offers the vendor an opportunity to build relationships with other vendors and manufacturers for the purpose of enhancing their product and service offering through strategic alliances and expanding their delivery channels, either locally or globally.
